name: Kecheng Yang 0001
content: Home Page â€“ Kecheng Yang Kecheng Yang Associate Professor in the Department of Computer Science Office: Comal Building 307C Email: yangk [at] txstate [dot] edu Short Bio I am an associate professor in the Department of Computer Science at Texas State University. I earned my Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, where I was advised by Prof. Jim Anderson in the Real-Time Systems Group. Education Ph.D., Computer Science, University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, August 2018. M.S., Computer Science, University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, May 2015. B.E., Computer Science and Technology, Hunan University, June 2013. Publications Teaching Awards and Honors CAREER Award, U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF), 2025. CRII Award, U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF), 2021. Outstanding Paper Award, 40th IEEE Real-Time Systems Symposium (RTSS), 2019. Best Student Paper Award, 40th IEEE Real-Time Systems Symposium (RTSS), 2019. Schloss Dagstuhl - NSF Support Grant for Junior Researchers, Dagstuhl Seminar 19101, 2019. Outstanding Paper Award, 26th International Conference on Real-Time Networks and Systems (RTNS), 2018. Dissertation Completion Fellowship, University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, 2018.
